_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: all valves, manifold components, gauges, alarms, pipes, compressors, vessel
_prev_prog_3.Description: This facility follows an OSHA format for its Process Safety Management Program which, with various additions, fulfills, its Accident Prevention Program Requirements.  It consists of a five volume set of binder and documents covering the following elements:  1) Employee and LEPC participation; 2) Process Safety Information; 3) Process Hazard Analysis which looks at off-site issues; 4) Standard Operating Procedures; 5) Training for the Process and emergency Response; 6) Contractor Reviews; 7) Pre-start up reviews; 8) Mechanical Integrity Audits; 9) Hot Work Permits; 10) Management of Change; 11) Incident Investigation; 12) Emergency Response Plan that addresses off site issues with LEPC; 13) Compliance Audits with a designated organization and responsibility chart.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
This Risk Management Program is designed to comply with the Environmental Protection Agency regulations detailed in 40 CFR Part 68.  The stationary source is Giant Distribution Center. Which is  located at 1621 Industrial Drive, Carlisle, PA 17013.  The site is owned by Giant Food Stores, Inc. The only RMP regulated substance at this facility is anhydrous ammonia - classification is as a toxic substance, liquefied under pressure. This facility was expanded to its current size in November 1999.   In July 2006, 4 additional banana rooms were added to the facility.  The new banana rooms tie into the system and require the addition of 700 pounds of ammonia to maintain the manufactures recommended safe operating pressure.   The system is included in this RMP with the Process Overview describing the system.  It will have a total inventory of approximately 26,903 pounds of anhydrous ammonia in its refrigeration system. This RMP is written to meet the Program 3 level of compliance.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICY
The facility has a complete Process Management Program in compliance with Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Process Safety Management (PSM). This program includes a process hazard analysis using the what-if techniques.   

EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY
The facility has a comprehensive emergency response plan that meets established criteria. This facility has a good working relationship with the Cumberland County LEPC. The plan has been provided to and reviewed with the LEPC and local fire department.

PROCESS OVERVIEW 
This food distribution facility operates a two temperature, single stage, anhydrous ammonia (R-717) refrigeration system with an engine room capacity of 509.4 TR @ +30A?F high temperature and 768.2 TR @ +14A?F medium temperature. This refrigeration system is a liquid re-circulation system and is designed to operate at an overfeed ratio of approximately 4:1 for all evaporators. Anhydrous ammonia (R-717) refriger

ant is a Group II refrigerant. Rotary screw and reciprocating compressors are used in the refrigeration system.

MITIGATION MEASURES
There are multiple mitigating measures in place. The location of  the ammonia vessels is inside the engine room. There is a fire sprikler system in the refrigeration machinery room and throughout this facility. The overall enclosure acts as a dike creating liquid pooling and limiting the liquid run-off. Ammonia leak detection is installed in this area that sounds alarms and starts emergency ventilation. The emergency ventilation is automatically controlled and discharges the engine room air through the roof which creates a lower level of concentration in the engine room for responders. It also starts air dispersion at lower concentration levels and disperses the ammonia with greater air turbulence.

SUMMARY OF HAZARD ASSESSMENT
The definitions and parameters for the release scenarios are based on RMP Comp.

The worst-case release scenario (OCA-1) used in this assessment identifies the high pressure receiver as the vessel with the potential to hold the largest quantity of ammonia. This scenario impacts off-site populations.

The alternative release scenarios evaluated in this hazard assessment include two possible scenarios. First alternate scenario (OCA-2)  is the direct release of ammonia vapor from the largest pressure relief valve with a duration of sixty minutes. The size of the release is based on the rated capacity of the pressure relief valve (79.6 lbs/min) with a release duration of sixty (60) minutes. 

The second alternative scenario (OCA-3) is the direct release of liquid from a A? "  diameter hole/valve in a vessel having an internal pressure of 181.1 psig. This scenario impacts off-site populations.

ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM
This facility follows the OSHA Process Safety Management Program, in addition to special requirements stipulated by the EPA.  There are 13 elements to the Accident Prevention Program.

ACCIDENT HIST

ORY - LAST FIVE YEARS
There have been no accidents involving injury, death, off-site sheltering-in-place, and/or evacuation in the last five years.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
The Giant Distribution Center is currently updating its  PSM program and revising SOPs.
